bug.short_desc: JPA Tools Plug-in SDK needs "valid license agreement".

long_desc.thetext:
Using the code from the latest M4 build, to create an update site, currently at http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/testUpdates
The SDK version of JPA can not be installed, as UpdateManager gives an error message of "JPA Tools Plug-in SDK (1.0.0.v200612180000-8OyBpm8t7u5jjgg) does not have a valid license agreement."
This may be another case of a missing property file? Or, maybe the feature.xml is not as expected.
Or ... it might be complicated by me not including the "org.eclipse.jpa.sdk" feature on the update site, as it seems not needed ... I have organized them all under "jst" so I used the org.eclipse.jst.jpa_sdk.feature as _the_ sdk feature. This parallels what JSF is doing (and other "top" components of JST). So, maybe some license or properties in o.e.jpa.sdk should be moved to o.e.jst.jpa_sdk.feature?
I marked as major since "missing sdk install" qualifies as a missing function.
The work around is to simply install the non-sdk version. But, I'd be willing to re-spin if you (JPA) want to fix this for M4 (and think it is a safe, sure-fire fix).
Fixed the SDK feature to display a valid license agreement.
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.

bug.short_desc: server @ localhost is already in use is _only_ logged?

long_desc.thetext:
Using M4 build from Thu, 4 Jan 2007 -- 01:46 (UTC) I had an apache server already running on my (windows) OS so when I tried to "debug on server", it didn't work. I got no message in IDE, but did get this (pasted below) message in the console log. (And, that's Eclipse's error/console log I mean, not the normal "server log" that shows up in IDE.
Didn't this use to have a message box? Was the change intentional? I can understand if it was intentional ... but, still hard to see what the problem might be, especially for new user, and especially since I think this is a common new user problem. Perhaps some validation-like message, or "error status" in server view would help?
= = = = = = !ENTRY org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core 4 0 2007-01-04 00:35:19.078 !MESSAGE Port 80 required by Tomcat v5.0 Server @ localhost is already in use. The server may already be running in another process, or a system process may be using the port. To start this server you will need to stop the other process or change the port number(s).

oh, and mind if I piggy-back another minor bug?
I think the '@' should be "at", in "server @ localhost is already in use" message, and would be best to include the desired port number!

This appears to be a regression in the platform - failed jobs no longer have any feedback. I think I've tracked it down to bug 168720, which is getting good attention - fingers crossed for a fix in the next platform milestone.
I've leave this bug here instead of returning as a duplicate since you made other comments:
* Change '@' to 'at'. Ok, will do.
* I don't understand your comment "would be best to include the desired port number". Are you saying it should scan for other free port numbers and suggest what ports to change to? FWIW you only had one port conflict (it checks all required ports, and the alternate message is "Several ports (8000, 8007, 8080) required by Tomcat ...") so the message could get a little interesting if that's what you were expecting.
Thanks Tim, on the "desired port number" ... I was missing that it appeared in the beginning of the message "Port 80 required by ... ", so, never mind.
Ok, will just use this bug to change '@' to 'at' then.
Change released to 2.0 M5 builds. Platform bug 168720 still open at the time of writing this but can be tracked at the source.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: XML Editor doesn't show content assistance for enumerate values

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 3.2.1
Steps To Reproduce: Most easily producible using the schema repository at www.starstandard.org.
It appears that at times that elements that have enumerated values do not always have their values show up in the content completion list (CTRL+space). When it doesn't work it always happens on the same elements.
The schemas in the above repository will produce the error, it happens at different places in sample XML depending on the schema being used. Generate an xml instance, and have it fill in all optional elements, and populate the elements. This will populate about 90% of the enumerated values, the instance generator will fail on several. At this time Content Assistance does not list the valid values for these elements. This only appears to happen on elements, and not attributes.
More information:
Craig, is this a limitation of our xsd models? Or, a simple bug somewhere?
Gabriel, please have a look at this when you have a chance.

Created an attachment (id=56554) Sample Test that duplicates the Content Assist problem
The sample XML and corresponding schemas can be used to reproduce the content assist bug. Particularly content assist is not working in any currency Attribute, and in some elements like Language. Oxygen XML, XML Spy, and other editors implement the content assist correctly. This same XML instance can be used to produce the bug where XML Instance Generation doesn't correctly populate a value in an enumerated list as it doesn't populate on the same fields that Content Assist has problems with as well.

Created an attachment (id=56599) Patch
The problem happens when the element/attribute is a simple type union of one (or more) enumerations. This patch solves this issue making it possible to see the corresponding enumeration values in the content assist proposals.
Created an attachment (id=56658) Refined patch
Created an attachment (id=56659) Refined patch

Any update on this? Is this going to be included in 1.5.3 Maintenance release. The patch looks like it will fix the exact problem I'm experiencing, and need for a potential XML workbench I'm working on creating.

I can verify that this patch fixes the problem. I downloaded it and installed the same changes into the WST 1.5.2 source, and exported the patched plugin. I then brought up the XML instances on content assist that were giving problems, it correctly brought up the content assistance for the enumerated types with unions.
For now I'll distribute my localized patched copy until it is incorporated into a maintenance release.
Still exists in 1.5.3.
Patch released
Released for 2.0M6
Closing.

bug.short_desc: There are some conflicts between super imposed meter chart series properties [0001]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: There are some conflicts between super imposed meter chart series properties.
Build number: 2.2.0.v20070102-1331
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a super imposed meter chart with two series. 2. In Format Chart tab, go to Series->Value Series - 1 and Series->Value Series - 2.
Expected result: Properties for both series should be consistent with each other.
Actual result: You can set series properties such as Radius, Start Angle, Stop Angle, Labels, Ragions, Ticks, Scale in both Value Series - 1 and Value Series - 2. For Regions property, you can both set in both series page, but what you set may conflict. And for other properties, only what you set in Value Series - 1 can work.
Error log: N/A
Improve the UI so there is no conflict.
New UI design required, since all value (Y) series of superimposed meter chart share same dial properties.

As all Y series of superimposed chart share same dial properties, having a new category under chart area as dial is a better way to handle inconsistencies.
Move properties like Radius, Start Angle, Stop Angle to dial category under chart area. Similarly tabs like regions, ticks and scale will also move under dials category. Doing so will have settings pertaining to dial area at one place only .
For superimposed meter charts, only a value series sheet is added. Put the needles-related properties in toggle button(Needles).
Verified in build (200704271305), closed.

bug.short_desc: Using an Orphanage to manage "is not contained in any resource"

long_desc.thetext:
2.0M3 I recently got an "is not contained in any resource" diagnostic, which was very reminiscent of my own direct usage of EMF and GMF. These are difficult to avoid since any imperfection in the EMF/GMF code, GMF synthesis, user configuration, user customisation or independent XML editing can provoke the problem.
The accompanying 'cannot save' prompt is not an acceptable user interface, first because the explanatory diagnostic is often not intelligible to a user, and secondly becuase the offending object is often invisible and so cannot be removed by even a skilled user.
With GMT/UMLX I found it very advantageous to introduce an additional Orphanage resource that contained all EObjects that were not otherwise contained. This ensured that files could always be saved, albeit with dangling links. Since the Orphanage was a true resource, and since it was visible in an Outline view, orphan objects could be highlighted with an error icon in the Outline and readily deleted by the user. Visible orphan objects could also be highlighted as with all errors and warnings with an overlay icon on their diagram label icon.
A further benefit of an Orphanage is that it solves the chicken and egg problem that currently prevents GMF supporting drawn containment:
1) create object A on Canvas as child of Domain Object mapped to Canvas 2) create object B on Canvas without an identified container 3) draw a containment link from B to A
step 2 is possible if the Orphanage acts as the container for B until step 3) identifies the true container.

I do not understand how do you get those "is not contained in any resource" (orphan objects) can you please list steps to repeat it?
Concerning drawing containment as a link - this feature supported by GMF (http://www.eclipse.org/gmf/new/gmf-new-1.0M5.php -> Containment References). all the objects without parent (incoming containment link) are stiored directly in the resource (root of objects tree). This idea looks similar to yours one.

I'm afraid that I cannot offer a repro. I'm sure it's my fault, triggered by upgrading the GMF diagram editor and/or evolving the Ecore model and re-using a diagram across upgrades. I may even have done some XML editing to try to make errors go away and causes a positional element alignment slippage.
My observation was that it's just about impossible to handle all the different stupidities that can occur, so the save activity must protect against the "not contained in any resource" message either by providing containment or by removing the element. A similar need for fix-up can arise with dangling references: the Ecore Diagram editor certainly has a bug here; if you delete a child node, the containment reference is not deleted and has a null eType - I was waiting till I had a clear M4 workspace to check that this wasn't caused by a mismatch of M4, M3 and CVS.

Re: #1 (http://www.eclipse.org/gmf/new/gmf-new-1.0M5.php -> Containment References) uses a mindmapTree example. Where is it? The standard mindmap example is at 1.1 on ecore and gmftool, so how can these subtopics be supported?
I can see that orphan objects could be visualised, but how can a diagram editor be defined that permits creation of (transient) orphans?

Re: comment #3. Mentioned sample is just internal sample created to check this feature. In general you can easily modify your diagram .gmfmap description to support it - you should add several top-level nodes without "containment feature" property specified for corresponding Top Node Reference and several link mappings holding corresponding containment references.

I do not feel it's reasonable to expect "not contained in any resource" error while saving diagrams; the problem seems to be rather specific to the changes made to definition or diagram files.
Alex, could you please take a look at the Ecore diagram problem mentioned in the comment #2 - deleting a child node? That one seems worth separate scr, while "not contained" problem sounds like a WONTFIX to me.
Re: comment #5 you are right - this is a problem of current Ecore diagram editor and can be fixed as a separate issue (have no connection to the "orphanage EObjects")

Closing this request since we can do nothing reasonable with manual modification of models..
Concerning the Ecore diagram problems - separated request submitted: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=170077

bug.short_desc: Can't enter margin of master page [05]

long_desc.thetext: Can't enter margin of master page [05] Build number:2.2.0.v20061229 Steps to reproduce: 1.switch to "Master Page" in layout and go to margin 2.the original left margin is 1.25in,select the left margin data,and input"0",then "0.00" will be displayed" Expected result: Only "0" is displayed Actual result: "0.00" is displayed Error log: N/A
Why do we think "0" and "0.00" are different?
If you want enter 0.1 in as left margin,it displayed ".10.00".
I have discussed with Qiangsheng and it's a bug.So reopen it.
Looks a bug of SWT. Please discuss with Chao and file a bug to SWT team.
*** Bug 169656 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This is the behavior of SWT spinner. Report a but 171760 to eclipse SWT.
After checking detaily, this bug is caused by our handling of selection event on spinner. SWT spinner works correctly.
As inputting in text and press "arrow up" (or "arrorw down") both invoke selection event. Needs further research to find solution to distinguish them.

Fixed it. Starts a timer once inputting digit in spinner, and save the input value after 1200 millionseconds.
Rico, please check if it is acceptable.
Verified and closed in build 2.2.0.v20070326-0630

Jerome Correnoz

bug.short_desc: getFocusCell returns old values when used from a selection listener.

long_desc.thetext: If you register a selection listener on a grid and use getCellSelection() and getFocusCell from the listener callback, it is apparent that the focus cell is the old (pre-selection) value, whereas the selection value is the new one.
Correction to problem description: The problem occur only when selecting with the mouse. Selecting with the arrow keys works correctly.

Created an attachment (id=56380) Proposed fix.
There are a number of places in onMouseDown where the selection listeners are notified before focus is updated. The proposed patch moves notification to after focus is updated.
all instances fixed.

bug.short_desc: corona log4j logging, not working when starting the server

long_desc.thetext:
When starting up corona server, the corona log4j logging is not working.
Following line is displayed on the console: osgi> [INFO] logService: null, logReaderService: null
and only system.outs are printed out.

The problem was in Log4jBundleActivator. When during corona.logger bundle startup, following services were not started:
* org.osgi.service.log.LogService * org.osgi.service.log.LogReaderService
the corona log4j service was not working properly.
To fix it two new service listeners for OSGI log services were added. Now corona log4j should start working as soon as those services are registered.

bug.short_desc: [DND] Can't find a way to get source in drop(...) and target in dragFinished(...)

long_desc.thetext:
3.3 M4
I plan to release text DnD feature today (see bug 11624). Currently when dragging and dropping into the same editor (i.e. StyledText instance) two text changes happen because I could not find a way to detect whether the drag source and the drag target come from the same StyledText widget.
Maybe I missed something but in the target listener (event) I could not find a way to get the original source (widget).
The effect of this bug is that we will need to undos to revert text move inside the same editor.
This would also allow to differ between dropping text (transfer) from an Eclipse StyledText widget or from some external source (e.g. a browser). This would be nice to set the correct drop detail.

One obvious hack is to use setData() to add an property to the control when a drag starts on the source. Check for the property in the drag target. If it's there, then the source and the target are the same. Am I missing something?

I already have yet uncommitted code that manages the state outside the eventing but I fear that in some situations (e.g. errors) some of the DnD events, e.g dragFinished(...) won't be sent and I would have some illegal internal state and hence thought having this information on the event would be safer.
Also note that while the drag source has a deterministic end (dragFinished) the drop target doesn't: drop is only called upon success which makes it harder to get a nice life-cycle.

And there's actually an even bigger problem: while I can solve the problem if it happens in the same editor (i.e. StyledText widget) I cannot fix it if the same document is opened in two editors. To solve this I need I way to get the source with the DropTargetEvent and the target with the DragSourceEvent.

For I20070116-0800 I released a workaround along comment 4 and comment 5. This fixes the undo problem when moving inside the same editor (StyledText widget) but not when the same document is opened twice and move happens from one to the other.

I looked quickly at the Windows DND implementation for the drop target. It gets an IDataObject but I can't find a way to map that back to an HWND (which we can use to find the drag source widget and then the drag source object).
Why does using setData() to set an object on the drag source widget when drag start, then looking for that property in notification in the drop target widget fail? Of course the property needs to be cleared etc. If the document is open twice, can't you check for identity on the object you get back from setData()?
Can you propose an API?

As outlined this works to detect/solve the initial problem where I only need to know whether it is the same (or not the same) editor/StyledText. But I don't think this works if the drag source needs to check whether it works on the same model as the target and where the widgets are different. And of course same check on the drop side.
>Why does using setData() to set an object on the drag source widget when drag >start, then looking for that property in notification in the drop target widget >fail? Because in the widgets are different. Maybe I'm missing something but if the source and the target widget are not the same, how/where would I read that data on drop? I found no way to get the source widget from which I could query the data and the data in the target widget is not set. On the other hand, on dragFinished the source widget won't have any info about the drop widget since they are different.
>Can you propose an API? DragSourceEvent.dropTarget // not valid in DragSourceListener.dragStart DropTargetEvent.dragSource
Ok, the drop target and drag source will also be different instances too, so I can't see how having the fields in the event helps either, right?
Exactly.
I'm thinking that we should close this bug as WONTFIX. Thoughts?

Yes - ok to close since as I already outlined in comment 4 I solved the "is same widget" problem and it seems not to be possible to solve the other case on your side.
FYI: the code in dragFinished from comment 12 will result in a CCE unless I missed something.
Ok, WONTFIX.

bug.short_desc: In Select AFL events Screen, there can be a scroll bar in the Available Events pane if we have more the 50 events.

Fixed in T5

bug.short_desc: Run As "Application" also takes installed but closed plug-in

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 3.2.1
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Close an installed eclipse plug-in, say 'foo'. 2. Create an IDEApplication, say 'bar', and run it. 3. Eclipse application spawned will have 'foo', as an installed and opened plug-in.
More information: If parent application has closed plug-ins (whether installed or created), they shouldn't appear as open plug-ins to child applications.

I am not sure I understand the scenario.
what do you mean by 'close an installed Eclipse plug-in'? 'installed' typically means that a plug-in that is not in the workspace, ie. a plug-in that is in the target platform as it appears on the Plug-in Development > Target Platform preference page. These plug-ins cannot be 'closed' since they are not in the workspace.

"Closed" plugin means that a plugin is disabled in the target platform of the running application. Now, when we spawn any other IDE application from this application, we will have the target platform in which all the plugins are enabled, by default.
Though disabling/enabling plugins is configurable in 'Run', but it's a tedious task to disable all the plugins when you have to disable a feature, consisting 'n' number of plugins. Thus, the default target platform for an application should be same as of its parent's.
In simpler words, from usage perspective, "features" should be configurable for a target platform in "Run", just as "plugins" are.

I am not sure why we are talking about features all of a sudden.
This bug report, I believe, is about launching a runtime workbench and seeing a plugin that should not be there. I just verified that such a thing does not happen, ie. if a plug-in is disabled/unchecked on the target platform preference page and you launch, the unchecked plug-in is by default excluded from the launch.
Can you please provide a more detailed reproducible scenario than the one in comment 0, starting with a fresh workspace?

I apologize for the aberrance, but what I want to state is that though the plugin is excluded from the launch but still the plugin will be listed in the "Help->Software Updates->Manage Configuration" section of the new launched application. Though it has an error icon but shouldn't it be disabled instead!
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Disable an installed eclipse plug-in, say 'foo'. 2. Create an IDEApplication, say 'bar', and run it. 3. Eclipse application spawned will have 'foo' in its "Help->Software Updates->Manage Configuration" section(with errors).

This bug is due to the table's view to model mapping was not cleaned up while the table data had been updated when user selected a different managed disk group. Since old mappings were being used to extract a row's data and to calculate its column sizes, exceptions might be thrown due to incorrect mappings. The table model must also be set before setting the table cell renderer to avoid ClassCastException occurred when renderer was applied to an old model.
Ok, it does work now.

bug.short_desc: A ThreadGroup (and all its Threads) is not displayed in the Debug view when its parent didn't contain any threads

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060629-1905
Steps To Reproduce: 1.Create new ThreadGroup(first) using the code "new ThreadGroup("<some name>")" - the parent of the newly created thread group will be the "main" thread group 2. After that create another thread group(second) under the first one 3. Create and start one or more threads under the second thread group 4. After running the program in debug mode and looking to the Debug view one will note that nor first nor second thread groups appear.
More information: In my opinion, the bug is not in JVM, because I checked - entire thread groups and thread hierarchy is correct and traversable in the Variables view.
More careful research resulted in a simple workaround found: before creating the second thread group, one must create and start at least one thread under the first thread group and then both thread groups appear in the Debug view correctly.

Created an attachment (id=64081) An Eclipse Project Detailing the Error
This project was used to produce the attached screenshots. Run Main.main to recreate the issue.

Created an attachment (id=64082) All threads shown
This shows all the threads without grouping by ThreadGroup

Created an attachment (id=64085) The Debug view showing the missing threads
This is the same running instance as the other screenshots and the threads from nested thread groups are missing

Created an attachment (id=64086) Debug variables of a paused thread showing group hiearchy
Again, this is the same running instance as the other screenshots - You can see from the highlighted variables that the hierarchy was created as coded

The "workaround" of spawning new threads has different results depending on how long the spawned thread lives:
For example, in the attached test case, for the top-most thread group, if a thread is spawned that will die immediately, its group (and all of its children) never show up in the debug view. However, if I let the spawned thread live for a few seconds, its group (and the children) show up in the debug view.
I'm not sure if this is a result of a) The JDT having a chance to poll for active threads OR b) the spawned thread being alive when the children threads come up
Investigating for 3.3

Fixed in HEAD. See JDIDebugTarget.
The only time the debug target is informed of new thread groups by the VM is when a thread is initialized. The problem was that only the thread's parent group would be initialized. If nested groups were created, the parent group was not initialized (because it has no threads underneath it).
This has been changed. When the debug target initializes a thread group, it iterates through the group's parents, initializing them, until an already initialized group is found.
Note: If a group (or a series of nested groups) contains no threads, it will not be displayed.
Mike, please verify.
verified

attachment.desc: An Eclipse Project Detailing the Error
The Debug view showing the missing threads
Debug variables of a paused thread showing group hiearchy

bug.short_desc: FilteredItemsSelectionDialog changes required by the JDT team.

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: I20061214-1445
List of required changes:
- Sorting now happens while searching; elements are continuously inserted what leads to a flickering view. It can happen that while you click on an entry, it moves away. In the old open type dialog, sorting was performed in the background and result where only the full result was shown, all sorted. Until then, only the history element were visible. When the full result was shown, you knew the best match immediately. I think the old behavior was superior and suggest to reimplement it.
- The view menu should use sentence capitalization: * 'Show status line' -> 'Show Status Line' * 'Show container for duplicates' > 'Show Container for Duplicates' (JDT dialog only)
- When the fitter box is empty, all history entries should be shown (currently no entries are shown)
- In the old version we simply ignored the search for '*'. The idea is that it is rarely interesting but happens when user start typing for something like '*List', and we don't want to block.
- Problem with the TypeNameMatches that do not exist. At the moment this is implemented in getResult, which looks like the wrong place. Best would be if a dialog is shown while the dialog is still open and that the dialog stays open if this happens. getResult can be called multiple times and also in a non-UI thread (both unlikely but possible).
- add support for input field selection modes (selection modes of initial patterns)
More information:

Created an attachment (id=56382) A patch for all of the problems listed in the previous comment.
- introduced a virtual table with a lazy content provider; moved some of the standard TableViewer methods to lazy content provider; abandoned the continous searching and sorting approach - items are sorted and displayed only after search is finished;
- splitted actions into a group of jobs - to seperate UI and non-UI operations, to provide means to easily stop job execution, to seperate marking duplicated items (definetly a long action)
- splitted progress monitors/progress messages
- logic moved from getResult to setResult;
- changed exception logging approach (new Status Handling facilities)
- when '*' (or '') is in the input field, only history is displayed; to get a list of all elements "**" have to typed
- introduced a new filtering job (for history items)
- added trimming of "\\*+" sequences into "\\*" to prevent unnecessary job repetition
- externalized messages, added capital letters
- moved checking for filters equality (subfilters) to SearchPattern
Patch released for HEAD for build >20070104
Verified in 20070206-0010

attachment.desc: A patch for all of the problems listed in the previous comment.

bug.short_desc: [AGR] Objects from included external Object Mines not found

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create two AGR test suites from within the same plugin, Suite 1 and Suite 2. 2. In Suite 1, record a test case that creates a new Java Project 3. In Suite 2, record a test case that creates a new File within this project 4. Add the invocation of each test case to the Behaviour of each respective test suite. 5. Include the Object Mine from Suite 1 in Suite 2. 6. Still in Suite 2,add the invocation of the test case from suite 1 (create Java Project) and move its invocation up to the top. 7. The Behaviour of Suite2 should now be: Suite1.createProject followed by Suite2.createFile. 8. Run suite 2 in standard mode. 9. Notice that the test suite fails because it can't find the Object references from the suite 1 invocation.
More information: The same scenario will succeed if the user selects 'Include Object IDs in test Macro' instead of using the Object Mine.

Any chance on raising the priority and/or severity on this one? It is crucial to our current test architecture. We cannot run our regression tests unless either this is fixed or we radically change our testing strategy.
Thanks.

This is a bit tricky to address. The problem is caused by reference id collisions between Suite1 and Suite2. When I originally added the include operation, I intended the option to be used in conjunction with the output option (i.e. all object id references would be outputted to a centralized suite).
Liz, I'm assigning this defect to you for further investigation. See if you can come up with a possible solution.
Changing priority to P1 and target to 4.4.
Updating original estimate based information provided by Liz.
Re-targeting to future based on time and resource constraints.
Reassigning to Project Lead until new Component Lead is assigned.

In TPTP 4.5, the AGR was moved from a Technology Preview component to an As-Is component. As-Is components are primarily provided for prior users but imply no support (for example, defects, news group, and mailing lists) or commitment to triage or resolve opened defects. For this defect to be considered, please re-open with an attached patch including code to resolve the symptom and test cases to test the fix.

bug.short_desc: Locals are never updated in Variables View if they are not in scope for their the first update

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: CDT 3.1.0.200606261600
Steps To Reproduce: Hi,
I have a problem with Variables View and locals variables with CDT 3.1. Not that it works fine with CDT 3.0.
With our core and debugger, the locals could be known by the debugger but they're accessible only when used.They have a limited scope.
In debug mode, when the program is stopped in a function, the CDT asks for the debugger the list of locals. Our debugger returns the list of locals of the function.
(gdb) 58-stack-list-locals 0 58^done,locals=[name="n_locale"]
Then CDT asks the debugger to create the associated variables (see createLocalVariable method in LocalVariable class). It may fail because the locals are not yet being used (not in scope). In MIVarCreate class, getMIInfo() method, the MIOutput is well parsed and the locals appear with an error icon(see variablesView1.jpg). The locals are then added to the variableList. Fine.
(gdb) 64-var-create - * n_locale &"No symbol \"n_locale\" in current context.\n" &"N/A\n" 64^error,msg="N/A"
The list of variables have to be updated on futher suspend events (processSuspendedEvent method in EventManager class). Then CDT tries to update these locals but as they've not been successfully created, the update fails and generates an exception when tryings to get the MIVar (varName = variable.getMIVar().getVarName() ) even if the debugger is now able to update the locals.
So, at this stage, I've modified a little the method "update(Target)" in VariableManager class. In the patch attached, if the update fails, I try to create again the variable and tries to update it. If it succeeds all is fine, elsewhere I throw a CDI Exception. With this patch, the locals are always updated when needed.
If you need more details, I would be happy to discuss about it. Feel free to comment the attached patch.
Regards, Jerome Correnoz
More information:
Created an attachment (id=56388) Patch for VariableManager.java
Created an attachment (id=56389) Patch for Variable.java
Created an attachment (id=56390) Diff between CDT 3.1 and modified file
Created an attachment (id=56391) Diff with CDT 3.1

Bonjour, I can understand the problem, but have some difficulties with the patch, can you generate it with unified context, 'diff -u'. Also having a test case, will be great 8-).
Is this with C++, which version of gdb?
Created an attachment (id=56396) Diff Variable.java with CDT 3.1
Created an attachment (id=56397) Diff VariableManager.java with CDT 3.1

I've just added the patch with 'diff -u'. Please let me know if it is OK now.
It is with C source code. The debugger used is our debugger for MMDSP core. Is is based on GNU gdb 5.3

This is a major performance issue for us and an apparent regression of 126526.
Andrew, would you investigate please? Thanks - CB.

The first call is used to populate the list of web service for a particular category type (getWebServicesByCategory). The second call is used to populate the list of all web services from all categories (getWebServices). We should cache the results when we retrieve the web services for each category, then combine the lists to form the master list so we do not have to invoke the finder implementation again.
In addition to the above, during my debugging I found a more serious performance issue, which is we are actually calling getWebServicesByCategory for each project we have in the workspace. Adding a caching mechanism should also solve this issue.

Created an attachment (id=56671) patch for wst.ws.explorer
This patch adds a vector to cache the web services that are retrieved for each category, and then used as the master list. Also, instead of calling getWebServicesByCategory again for each project, it now retrieves the web services from the vector as well.
Yen, please give this patch, thanks.
Andrew, the patch appears to resolve the issue.
Thanks Yen. The patch is now ready for review and commit.
Andrew, nicely done on the patch. Reviewed, committed and released to HEAD (tag v200701171853) and R1_5_maintenance (tag v200701171855).

bug.short_desc: Alert ID associated with CIMOM discovery T_SCHEDULE entry is incorrect

long_desc.thetext:
The alert ID associated with the CIMOM discovery job entry in T_SCHEDULE is incorrect. The insert statement in AlterVersion005000000.sql looks like this:
INSERT INTO "T_SCHEDULE"
VALUES (110, '{109}', '{112}','{114}', 0, '{109}', '1', '3', 2001, 01, 01, 3, 30, '2', '4', 1, '2', '2', '2', '2', '2', '2', '2', '2',
'1', {9}, {9}, 114, 'J', 1, 0) ;
Alert ID 114 (set in the last row of the above statement, just before 'J') corresponds to a subsystem discovery alert. So, as it stands, failure of a CIMOM discovery job incorrectly triggers a subsystem discovery alert. The alert ID associated with the CIMOM discovery job entry in T_SCHEDULE should be set to 110, which corresponds to the appropriate job failure alert.
This issue can, and will, be resolved by adding the following update statement to AlterVersion005000002.sql:
update t_schedule set alert_id = 110 where schedule_id = 110 ;
A fix for this issue has been tested and checked into CVS.

bug.short_desc: [CommonNavigator] [DND] - Drag/drop within the project explorer; doesn't scroll

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 3.2.1.
Steps To Reproduce: 1.Open Package Explorer in Jave perspective 2.Have in your Package Explorer a lot of projects open that they can not fit all in visible part of project explorer 3.Select an element in project exporer and drug/drop it upor down in the project explorer beyond the visible area of the tree.
More information: Problem: The project explorer doesn't scroll up or down to enable the element to be dragged along the tree beyond what can be seen in the project explorer. Notice, this will happen If your drugged element get "not allowed to drop" image.
Expected: I would expect that the project explorer would scroll up or down if the element is dragged beyond the visible area. In a large project, this makes drag/dropping elements between different folders impractical.

Note that some scrolling does occur. If the bottom or top of the list is not a folder, then the view does scroll until a folder that can receive the object comes into view. At that point scrolling stops, which isn't what is desired. Compare this to how Windows Explorer works, where you can see that scrolling continues even if the last visible line is a folder or not.

I believe the problem is in JDT UI and in Platform UI.
In the case of the Package Explorer, the DelegatingDropAdapter.updateCurrentListener method searches for a listener that can support the dragged object. If none is found, the event.detail is set to DND.DROP_NONE but the event.feedback is not set to DND.FEEDBACK_SCROLL | DND.FEEDBACK_EXPAND. May be you would want to include DND.FEEDBACK_SELECT too.
In the case of the Project Explorer, the CommonDropAdater.validateDrop method is explicitly turning off expand and scroll when an "invalid" target object is encountered. I commented out the line "setScrollExpandEnabled(result);" where result is false. This made scroll and expand worked.
Are you talking about the PACKAGE or the PROJECT explorer (that's not the same thing)?

Committed in >20070122. I've added the code in the DelegatingDropAdapter to enable the FEEDBACK_EXPAND/SCROLL in the case where there is no valid listener.
The CommonDropAdapter issue looks like it should be assigned to Michael Elder since he's the owner of that component...
I've added him to the CC list and moved the bug back to the Platform UI...

bug.short_desc: SWT_AWT Swing modal dialogs do not stay on top on Unix

long_desc.thetext:
Using the SWT_AWT bridge, modal Swing dialogs do not work as expected on Unix. The problem seems to be with the XEmbeddedFrame, which is the frame returned by the SWT_AWT bridge on Unix. When this frame is used as the parent of the JDialog, even if the dialog is set as modal, it always goes behind the parent window when the parent window is clicked. The dialog does not stay in front as expected (although mouse actions on the parent window do not invoke anything). This has been tried on Linux, Solaris and AIX with the same behavior.
On Windows, the SWT_AWT frame used is WEmbeddedFrame, and this works fine. The dialog stays in front in this case. I wrote a snippet that demonstrates the problem, which I will upload shortly.

Created an attachment (id=56400) Sample program to create a modal swing dialog
Attached a sample program that shows this problem. If the program is executed on any Unix platform as an SWT snippet, the problem can be seen.
A breakpoint set after the creation of the JDialog will show the "parent" field of the dlg variable as "XEmbeddedFrame". On Windows, this is "WEmbeddedFrame".

I found the following bug report in the SUN bug database that may be related to this problem: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6507476.
The evaluation for that bug says:
========================================================== When SWT shell is activated, it sends us the client message XEMBED_WINDOW_ACTIVATE. Then, when AWT button is clicked with the mouse, embedded frame sends XEMBED_REQUEST_FOCUS client message to the SWT shell and receives a reply as XEMBED_FOCUS_IN. However, if the embedded frame is blocked (or is unfocusable because of some another reason), it shouldn't request focus from embedder.
Also, I haven't found any place in XEmbed specification that states that XEMBED_FOCUS_IN is only sent in reply to XEMBED_REQUEST_FOCUS. So we should not only prevent our embedded frames from requesting focus, but also filter all XEMBED_FOCUS_IN messages when the frame is unfocusable. ==========================================================
Using this information, I had a thought that it may be possible to make the SWT Shell refrain from sending the XEMBED_FOCUS_IN to the XEmbeddedFrame when it knows that the frame is not focusable (as would be the case when there is a modal dialog on the frame). Is there a way to handle the event in the SWT Shell to do this, as a workaround? That way, I could at least temporarily implement such a workaround in our application code...

Ok, this WORKSFORME on Windows, Linux GTK and Linux Motif running SWT from HEAD. It is possible that it is failing on Solaris but I have no time to try it right now. It is also possible that the problem is already fixed.

0) Invoke the sample code 1) Press the Swing button 'Click Here' 2) Move 'Sample Swing Modal dialog' to overlap 'SWT_AWT Modal Swing Test' 3) Click somewhere inside 'SWT_AWT Modal Swing Test' 4) 'SWT_AWT Modal Swing Test' should not come to the front

I was able to reproduce this failure on:

On Linux GTK, it worked as expected (and I tried switching up GTK versions, going back to GTK 2.4.14).
On GTK the XEmbedSupport is implemented by GTK in gtksocket-x11.c. SWT creates a new socket and then lets GTK handle the details so there isn't anything we can hack for GTK.
We take care of the focus events on Motif and we tried commenting out all of the places that we send the XEMBED_FOCUS_IN message. Unfortunately, it didn't have any effect on the modality of the dialog.
I'm not sure if there's anything else we can do to help. If your main platform of concern is Solaris GTK (it's quite possible that they have their own version of GTK) maybe following the issue up with them might be a way to proceed.

To me, this says their is a difference/bug in the X server, window manager or AWT's XEmbed implementation for those platforms because the same SWT XEmbed implemetation works on Linux.
Sorry but I'm going to have to mark this WONTFIX. Please reopen when you have more information, perhaps from Sun?

I tested this with XServers like Exceed and Cygwin/X. The problem appears even with those XServers. So this does not appear to be related to the XServer. Also, in comment #16, Rajendra mentioned that it did not work on Linux GTK 32-bit. I had tried Linux GTK 64-bit, which did not work for me too...
We were unable to make it fail on GTK Linux. Bogdan, I am correct, right?

You are right. Following the steps in Comment #3, Linux GTK 32-bit behaved as expected. I tried it with both the Sun (jdk1.5.0_11) and IBM JVMs (ibm-java2-i386-50) and with the following versions of GTK:
2.4.14 2.6.10 2.8.20 2.10.6

bug.short_desc: Chart Marker Line is above the Series Line

long_desc.thetext: If I'm adding a marker line in a Chart this line is above the Series lines. The series line should above the marker line
Created an attachment (id=56401) screenshot of the chart
This is a z-order issue of rendering in 2D. The marker line should be rendered after the series line.

It's difficult to establish the best possible behavior. In case of line or area charts, it's probably better to have the marker line in front. Needs further analysis to come up with a good solution that fits all cases.
Change Axis MarkerLine's z-order to the bottom, so it won't hide Series Line

bug.short_desc: [services] Add an explicit priority argument to the DsfSession.addServiceEventListener()

long_desc.thetext: Currently, the priority of the listener is determined by the DsfSession class implementation. The implementation checks if the listener is an instance of IDsfService, and if so, it extracts the startup number of the service, which is the priority. This mechanism is inflexible. If a service contains another class, such as the cache manager, the cache manager cannot be registered directly as an event listener. Instead, add listener method itself should take the priority as an argument.

bug.short_desc: Memory consumption by the ListCompartmentEditPart can be reduced

long_desc.thetext: List compartment edit part holds a list of semantic listeners, this list can be replaced by an Integer, since all we need to remove the listeners is the listener count
Fixed

bug.short_desc: Child Shell's Image changes dock icon on OS X

long_desc.thetext: When you set an Image on a child Shell, you also change the icon that's displayed in the dock on OSX. The dock icon should remain the same as the parent Shell.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: API deficiency in IServer.publish

long_desc.thetext: This would require a similar change in the PublishServerJob, which admittedly is internal and trivially easy to duplicate, but would still benefit from the change.

Agreed; I knew this was coming. No plans in the short term yet for when this would be implemented and what changes would be made to the Servers view (although most likely an individual Publish option on each module).
I could care less about the ui's impl dealing with the issue. I just want the core to be changed as soon as is possible to allow for it. ;)
*** Bug 200279 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 205319 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: [Presentations] CTabFolder should not use the ellipsis

long_desc.thetext:
M4
The CTabFolder is losing too much information by trying to shorten with an ellipsis. I will attach a patch that no longer uses it and also removes the image later.
The use of the ellipsis meant that useful title information was being removed too soon - we just not using it we retain more information.
We also had too large of a minimum image width so we were removing the image width before we needed to.
Kelvin, McQ and Kevin - we looked into using the image instead of text when the tab got small and it turns out that the current implementation is the most sensible.
The image is only removed if there is no space to show it. In that case we use whatever text we can in that space. The only thing worth changing was the margin added for determining minimum space required for the image- it was large enough that you never got the image without text case.
I will apply a patch.
Created an attachment (id=56405) Patch for CTabItem
There are other places where '...' are used. Do they make sense as well?

I am going to take this one back - we are going to play around with several ideas in the 3.3 presentation and come back to you with more concrete answers.
I'm also not sure if the community will like this change to be applied outside of the SDK so we are better to start out with just us.
And yes we are trying to look at all cases where we use an ellipsis and see if we can do better.
Fix released to the 3.3 presentation for build >20070116
Verified in 20070206-0010

bug.short_desc: remote search/index framework

long_desc.thetext:
We are looking to provide modifications that would introduce a framework for enabling ISVs to extend CDT with remote development capabilities. The modifications would be centered on making the search and index features of CDT extensible in such a way as to allow them to be used with resources that exist on a remote system in an efficient manner.
The idea is to apply an enterprise design pattern that would decouple the index from the UI components that use it. We are providing a design document here for review.
Created an attachment (id=56406) initial design document
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 158975 ***

bug.short_desc: update feature versions to 3.2.2

long_desc.thetext:
For the following features in the 3.2 maintenance stream
jdt pde platform rcp sdk equinox
The plugins have incremented to 3.2.2 and 3.2.3 so we should update the features to 3.2.2.
From the version numbering guidelines http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Version_Numbering#Feature_includes
Note that the magnitude of the change does not need to match between the feature and its plug-ins. If a plug-in increments its service number by two for some reason, it does not mean that the feature must also increase the number by two.
actually, pde is fine. The others have been updated and released for the next M-build.

bug.short_desc: Modifications via Trac connector does not trigger email sending.

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create task via browser 2. Modify this task via browser, add a user in the CC field. The user receives an email abou the task. 3. Do the same using trac connector, no email is sent when modifications are done on the tasks.
More information:
The Trac XML-RPC Plugin (http://trac-hacks.org/wiki/XmlRpcPlugin) currently does not invoke Trac's ticket notification API. I recommend to file a feature request in their bug tracker.
See http://trac-hacks.org/ticket/1069.

Committed a patch to CVS as part of bug 170862 that will trigger sending of notifications if the XML-RPC Plugin supports it (see patch at http://trac-hacks.org/ticket/1069 ). I will keep this report open until the patch is officially merged.

Patch has been merged in revision 1950 of the XML-RPC Plugin. Notifications will work with that revision.
Note, that the Trac connector is backwards compatible with revision 1735 (for now) but notifications are not sent.

bug.short_desc: Zend debugger 5.2.3 does not stop in any breakpoints

long_desc.thetext:
PHP IDE 0.7.0 20070101 Eclipse 3.2.1 PHP Version 4.3.10
This program makes use of the Zend Scripting Language Engine: Zend Engine v1.3.0, Copyright (c) 1998-2004 Zend Technologies with Zend Debugger v5.2.3, Copyright (c) 1999-2006, by Zend Technologies
I followed the instructions here (except that I use 5.2.3 of the debugger instead of 5.2.1)
http://mprobst.de/SherlockWeb/?postid=2
Like I have seen in other postings here, when I specify to stop initially, it correctly does so, however, if I have any breakpoints, whether they be in the outer (index.php) file, or included files, they are never hit.
However, I can see that the debugger is getting invoked when I an fetching a page that invokes PHP, when when I hit the suspend button in the debugger window, it stops as I expect and gets a good stack along with showing the variable state and such.

Problem appears also with the XDebug debugger: Hi Dave, I have made a very simple test application with a couple of breakpoints and it does not hit the breakpoints at all (the behavior is exactly the same as when used with the Zend debugger). Here is my test program: "; print "

Hi Mom!"; print "

Hi Mom again."; print "

Hi mom yet again"; print ""; ?> I set a breakpoint on each line, and execute this with the XDebug debugger, and none of the breakpoints it hit, and the page appears in the browser. If I set it to break on the first line, it does properly stop there, but when I continue, it just finishes ignoring the breakpoints. This problem is essentially the same as: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=169575 I will put this as an attachment to the bug report, because it appears that the problem might not have anything to do with the specific debugger, rather it is in the client side support for communicating breakpoints. Francis
My comment related to XDebug is unrelated to this; I was able to resolve the XDebug problems and make it respect breakpoints.
I'm also finding this bug to be a pain - help please!

I also have the same problem.
I used slightly older of php ide and the zend debugger but upgraded them today to the latest versions which are now as follows:
PHP IDE 0.7.0 20070111 ZendDebugger-5.2.3-linux-glibc21-i386 PHP V4.4.0-pl1-gentoo Eclipse 3.2.0 - Build id: M20060629-1905 (the all in one package from zend's site)

Again the same problem with breakpoints...
Eclipse SDK Version: 3.2.1 Build id: M20060921-0945
PHP IDE v 0.7.0
ZendDebugger-5.2.3-Windows-i386

Hi,
I am the author of "Almost too good to be true: Debugging PHP with Eclipse PHP IDE and Zend Debugger on Mac OS X", which explains the installation on a PPC (non-Intel) Mac.
I am happy to realize this how-to has helped a lot of people to get running installation, but unfortunately this only works for PPC (non-Intel) Macs as the debugger will not stop at breakpoints on an Intel-Mac. Thus, I would really like to be able to share a positive experience if somebody has been able to set it up correctly on an Intel-Mac.
I know this has been a topic here lately, but no one really seems to be sure about the result, so I would like to point out clearly whether it is a bug or a configuration issue:
* * * Is there anybody that gets Eclipse PHP Tools (PDT -- formerly Eclipse PHP IDE) stopping at the breakpoints on an Intel (!) Mac? * * *
The main problem seems to be the 5.2.3 version of the ZendDebugger.so. Unfortunately, the 5.2.1 version which worked fine is not installable on an Intel Mac.
Thank you very much for your responses,
michael
ps. If you wish to reply, please use the comment function on my blog.
I got same problem on windows XP PHP 5.1x Zend debugger 5.2.3 Eclipse 3.2

Pretty much a "me too", but what is (hopefully) interesting is that suspend and resume seem to work fine, so if I try something like:
<?php for ($i = 1; $i < 10; $i++) { print $i; sleep(1); // give me time to hit pause } ?>
I can pause and resume fine whilst in the loop, and get variable states etc, but cheerfully ignores any breakpoints I set.
Client:
WinXP Pro Eclipse 3.2.0 PDT 0.7.0.v20070214
Server:
Linux: 2.6.15 ZendDebugger 5.2.3 PHP 4.4.4
I also tried 5.2.1 but got various "[Zend Debugger] Unknown debugger command of type 10000" errors.

Eclipse SDK Version: 3.2.2 Build id: M20070212-1330 Zend Engine v2.2.0 Zend Debugger v5.2.3
Sure would be nice if we could get this fixed.
Seems to be problematic when not specifying a file name in the URL. Works fine when I use an URL like this:
http://localhost/index.php
But does not work when using an URL like this:
http://localhost/delete/id/6/
Normally this would be good workaround except when using the Zend framework which uses a redirect to index.php for all URLs, and the URLs do not include a file name.

The problem seems to be SOLVED:

I just wanted to shed a little personal experience to see if I might be able to resolve this problem for a few people. I had configured my server to use a symlink in /var/www that pointed to /home/myname/workspace/project. Because the file path of the two resources didnt match when the debugger was working the only way i was able to get the debugger to stop was with a sleep(X) statement and a manual pause. After i read up on the issues regarding paths in xdebug i thought i might be experiencing the same problem and it turned out i was.
So long story short if you are experiencing the inability to stop at breakpoints and running php5.2.X and zenddebugger 5.2.3 please try making sure that your httpconf defines the same working root as your eclipse project path instead of just a symlink to the "same" location. It worked for me.

As a revisit the breakpoints only continued to work while i was testing the SAME URL as the "File/Path" specified under "debug... > php web page" . My web application uses modrewrite so any page after that first page wouldnt work. I attempted to append the cleanURL as a GET variable (e.g. index.php?q=my/path) but the debugger failed to stop again despite the same "root name"

Eclipse 3.2.0 (pdt-0.7.0.S20070401-RC3_debugger-0.1.7-all-in-one-win32.zip) PHP Version 4.4.4 Zend Engine v1.3.0 Zend Debugger v5.2.3 Windows XP
Ok, I had the problem where it wasn't stopping at breakpoints as well, but as Dennis pointed out there was a way around it. The settings listed below are all that I changed/set to allow me to debug an entire project:
Server Tab File/Project = /forum/index.php URL = http://localhost/forum/index.php (had to manually edit this) Advanced Tab Session Settings - Open in Browser selected - Start Debugging From = http://localhost/forum/index.php - Continue Debug from this Page selected
With these settings I can debug the entire project (vbulletin forum) and it will stop at all breakpoints in all files.
I'm not sure if any other combination of settings work, but this seems to work for me when it didn't before.

Eclipse 3.2.0 (pdt-0.7.0.S20070401-RC3_debugger-0.1.7-all-in-one-win32.zip) PHP Version 4.4.4 Zend Engine v1.3.0 Zend Debugger v5.2.3 Windows XP
Like so many others, the ZendDebugger appears to function fine without errors, but will not stop at any breakpoints. It will, however, stop if "Break at First Line" is checked, and you can continue stepping through, but it is a huge pain.
On my machine, I discovered that the ZendDebugger would work with some projects and not others. I determined that the difference was that the ones which worked were using Auto-Generate for the URL.
For example, previously I may have specified the Eclipse Project to begin at "C:\Workspace\Project-A" and had the index file located at "C:\Workspace\Project-A\trunk\index.php". But you can't use URL Auto-Generate because it thinks the URL is "http://www.yourserver.com/trunk/index.php" when it is actually "http://www.yourserver.com/index.php"... Even though everything else appears to work, the ZendDebugger does not.
My solution was, therefore, to move the project root to "C:\Workspace\Project-A\trunk" with the index file located at "C:\Workspace\Project-A\trunk\index.php" and leaving URL Auto-Generate on with the URL correctly generated as "http://www.yourserver.com/index.php".
Now it is stopping at all breakpoints! :)

> On my machine, I discovered that the ZendDebugger would work with some projects > and not others. I determined that the difference was that the ones which worked > were using Auto-Generate for the URL.

I tried http://localhost/web and even http://localhost/ (only ending slash added), then it will not work.
So, now I have http://localhost and I disabled Auto Generate and entered URI and it works :)

1. Make sure you are using the latest PDT. 2. Make sure that the inner paths of the files in your project are similar to what you have on the server. Especially, make sure that the included files path is similar. 3. We will work out a solution for non-trivial settings of path mapping in the near future. For now, the path mapping is very strict and will fail if the server holds a different directory structure then expected.

bug.short_desc: Add diagram menu and toolbar to generated RCP application

long_desc.thetext: The diagram menu and the toolbar is missing from a generated RCP application targeting the full runtime.

The Diagram main menu did not appear in a GMF generated RCP application because our Diagram main menu is contributed to the group "project" which is not available in the generated RCP application. I modified the plugin.xml file in the org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.providers plugin to contribute this menu to the "edit" group instead. It will move slightly to the left.

bug.short_desc: [Perspectives] ISV doc for adding a show-in target is misleading

long_desc.thetext:
In the ISV doc at org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/guide/workbench_perspectives.htm, the last paragraph says:
"Presenting appropriate targets How is the list of available targets determined? You can specify the available targets for your perspective in its IPageLayout. Recall that a "show in" navigation may open a view that is not already present in the perspective. Using IPageLayout.addShowInPart, you can specify a valid "show in" target by id. In this way, the valid targets can be established without unnecessarily creating any views."
I think what it should say is that clients should use a perspective extension to add a show-in-target to a perspective. I searched for references to IPageLayout#addPartToShow and there was only one reference in the SDK.

bug.short_desc: [quick fix] change type parameter of a generic constructor on type mismatch in an assignment

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060629-1905
Steps To Reproduce: 1. create a field with a generic type, say "HashMap<Integer, String> foo" 2. initialize the field by assigning a constructor: "foo = new HashMap<Integer, String>()" 3. change the type parameter of the field: "Map<Integer, StringBuffer> foo" 4. the assignment from step 2 is incorrect now. Quick fix suggests changing the type of foo.
It would be nice (and the right action in this example) if there were a quick fix to change the type parameter of the constructor in the assignment's RHS: "foo = new HashMap<Integer, StringBuffer>()"

bug.short_desc: [ViewMgmt] Investigate concept of "pinnable view"

long_desc.thetext: The search view is a multi-instance view with history and the ability to pin the current search view to make sure it stays open. We should investigate whether we can support this as a general concept so that other view implementers can use it rather than having to implement their own (and potentially introducing inconsistencies).

The History and the Console view already have something similar. The Synchronize view has also pin functionality; however, it does not spawn another view, but just makes sure a synchronization is not removed from the history.

bug.short_desc: XDS Source not properly generating oids

long_desc.thetext:
our algorithm for generating oids allows leading zeros which is not compliant with the CDA definition for OID:
" A globally unique string representing an ISO Object Identifier (OID) in a form that consists only of non-negative numbers with no leading zeros and dots (e.g., "2.16.840.1.113883.3.1"). According to ISO, OIDs are paths in a tree structure, with the left-most number representing the root and the right-most number representing a leaf. "
The OID generator has been updated to convert leading 0's in segments to 1's
closed for 2007 branch

bug.short_desc: Refactor PCView to use container events

long_desc.thetext:
The ProjectContainerView currently handles OSGi events, not container events. This needs to be updated to use the ContextContainer event handling model.
The ContextContainer event handling model provides an ContextContainerEventManager as well as AbstractContextContainerEventHandler. These classes enable each event handler to be invoked within their own Eclipse job (thread).

Removed the handling of native OSGi events from PCView. Each PCView-Page is required to register its own abstract container event handler with the ContextContainerEventManager.
See PCView-Page for TeamMember as an example.
Marked as close for 1.0.0M8 build

bug.short_desc: [Common Navigator] Show In fails for editor inputs

long_desc.thetext: The show(ShowInContext) method for CommonNavigator only considers the selection of the context. When Show In Project Explorer is performed from an editor, the selection is empty and the input is provided. Unfortunately, this is problematic, as the show-in target needs to adapt the input to an IFile so this will probably need to have some sort of extension so that the Project Explorer can plug-in the proper support.
Fix released to HEAD
Verified using I20070322-1800
*** Bug 175878 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: Repository provider not consulted when project is copied.

long_desc.thetext: If I copy a project the repository provider is not consulted, and the new copy of the project is also associated with the same provider as the source. However the repository provider does not know anything about this new project.

This capability would need to be provided by the resources plug-in. One possibility would be to extend the move/delete hook. However, another possibility is for the repository provider to use an EFS that wraps the local file system. This way, they would be able to intercept any file system operations. However, I suspect that in this later approach, detecting a project copy may be difficult.
Related to bug 37722 and bug 27879

bug.short_desc: two versions of xerces doesn't get recognized right after update

long_desc.thetext:
There's an interesting case coming up in Europa M4 that's kind of interesting.
It may not occur in a pure update scenerio, so for now, I'll just describe what we are seeing.
I'm initially opening this on "update", but could imagine the problem is elsewhere.
To test our M4 version of WTP, we start off, for now, with downloaded versions of all pre-req zips ... platform, gef, emf, and DTP ... this latter zip includes a xerces plugin with following version ... org.apache.xerces_2.8.0.v200606131651
Now, we update for WTP, which installs following version, as it should.
org.apache.xerces_2.8.0.v200612131415
But, upon the usual restart-after-update, we start getting weird class cast exceptions and others.
So, the bug being, if you restart eclipse with -clean, it then works fine. I would have thought the update-restart cycle would do the equivalent of -clean?

This is very similar to bug 155996. I recommend we dup it.
Can someone on the update team please outline the policy used when new versions of bundles are detected. In this bug and in bug 155996 it looks like update is detecting new versions of a bundle (xerces in this case) and installing it but it is not uninstalling the old bundle. Does update ever uninstall old versions of bundles. If so when?
The issue here is we end up with more than one version of xerces RESOLVED in the system. Bundles that are already RESOLVED are not forced to resolve to the new version of xerces, but newly installed bundles are allowed to resolve to the new version of xerces. This can lead to inconsistent class spaces which will cause ClassCastExceptions.
There are a few options we should consider to address this issue:
1) Add the "uses" directive to all Export-Package statements in all eclipse bundles. This will be next to impossible without tooling, see bug 167968. But with the uses directive the framework can ensure that bundles are using the same packages when they interact with eachother. One downside to this is that it will force bundles to resolve to older versions of xerces because others are using it already.
2) Investigate the policies used by update when new versions of bundles are installed. Should update uninstall the old versions of the bundles?
3) Force old bundles to be refreshed when new ones are installed. When update installs bundles it eventually calls PackageAdmin.refreshPackages. Currently it passes all the bundles it has installed and uninstalled (note that the old version of xercies did *not* get uninstalled). The framework currently is doing some special case processing for singleton bundles passed to refreshPackages (see bug 62260). This forces the old versions of the singleton bundles to be refreshed when new singleton bundles are installed. Maybe we should consider doing this for all bundles, not just singleton bundles. So, when a new version of xerces is installed we would force the old version of xerces to be refreshed. This would force all bundles depending on the old version to be re-resolved to the newest possible version.
For the short term option 3 seem the most appealing to me. But I'm not sure where the processing should go. Currently the Framework does extra processing to refresh old versions of singleton bundles. We could easily update this code to handle all bundles (not just singletons). But this hardcodes the policy into the framework. Another option is to add the processing to update.configurator since it is the one calling PackageAdmin.refreshPackages. The downside here is that it only fixes the cases where update is used, other management agents may have a similar issue.
Thoughts?
P.S. For the long term we really need to add the "uses" directive to our exports, but that does not solve all of our problems.

Dup to bug 155996. I will attach a patch to bug 155996 for a possible framework fix discussed in option 2 of Bug 169593 comment 1.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 155996 ***

bug.short_desc: CP wizard fails to refresh

long_desc.thetext:
* Eclipse 3.3M4, DTP 1.0 on Ubuntu *
1. Create a new driver template for Apache Derby embedded using the Pref page 2. Create a new connection profile, select Apache Derby --> Notice that the first (and only in this case) driver template is automatically chosen in the combo box, but none of the template values are added to the rest of the wizard fields. This is different from Windows where no driver template is chosen by default, and selecting one refreshes the rest of the wizard fields. If you have more than one template and flip between them, then the wizard starts to update. If you have only one template, however, you can not get the wizard to refresh. Clicking on "Next" in the wizard generates the following error: eclipse.buildId=I20061214-1445 java.version=1.5.0_06 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86

Brian,
This looks like an SWT oddity. Please review the initialization code for the wizard page to make sure the execution paths are valid (i.e. the controls are created, then initialized, then validated). My guess is that something is out of order on Ubuntu. Most likely, the fields are being initialized from a listener on the driver definition drop list. The listener is probably notified when the initial selection is set on Windows, but not on Ubuntu. You might want to scan BZ to see if this is a known problem in SWT/JFace.
Rob

Was able to reproduce on Ubuntu. We've discovered a discrepancy between org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Combo behavior on Windows and Linux (Ubuntu). When you do a programmatic selection (i.e. this.mComboList.select(0);), it doesn't trigger the Change event (i.e. I have added a change listener to the control).
I have a workaround, but we suspect this may be a bug in the Platform code. Have submitted BZ entry 173939 to let them know. Have submitted patch to Rob Cernich for review that I tested on both Windows and Ubuntu and it works fine.
Committed fix for this issue today to the DTP codeline. Will come up with example to give the SWT team to try and reproduce.
verified and closing.

bug.short_desc: DesignFileException - duplicate style name in web app

long_desc.thetext:
I have a rptdesign that references a rptlibrary. In the designer and in the preview everything looks fine. But when I run the report in the web app (generated by the new wizard), it throws a DesignFileException. It complains that the style "NewStyle" is used twice.
The report just references the library, it does not use any elements from it. If I remove the reference, the report can also be viewed in the web app. The report contains two text fields, that refer to the same style name "NewStyle". Thats what causes the error. If one of the styles is removed, the error disappears. Also the error disappears, when you remove the reference to the library (which is not used at all). Finally it maybe has something to do with the Text element, in another context a Data element worked fine with multiple references to the same style.
bad.rptlibrary
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <library xmlns="http://www.eclipse.org/birt/2005/design" version="3.2.9" id="1"> <property name="createdBy">Eclipse BIRT Designer Version 2.1.1.v20060922-1058 Build <20060926-0959></property> <property name="comments">Copyright (c) 2006 <<Your Company Name here>></property> <property name="theme">defaultTheme</property> <themes> <theme name="defaultTheme" id="2"/> </themes> <page-setup> <simple-master-page name="MyMasterPage" id="3"/> </page-setup> </library>
bad.rptdesign

Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.

bug.short_desc: [clean up] Move ICleanup and IFix out of UI

long_desc.thetext:
The ICleanup and IFix seem to be based in the UI plugin for no obvious reason. If they were based in the JDT Core instead, they could be utilised from a batch process e.g. a cleanup on check-in on the server side.
To be honest, they would also be useful in other languages or for other types of files, too. One could imagine a CleanUp for a Python or Ruby script, or an XMLCleanUp that formatted and/or pretty-printed an XML file.
Is there any thought being given to making these available in a more generic package e.g. IDE?
At some point, it may also be nice to allow users to submit their own cleanups through an extension point. Currently, if you are adding a new clean up, you have to add a new CleanUp() to a particular source file. If they were contributed as extensions, then it might be possible to add more dynamically after the release of a standard Eclipse build.

Marking as dependent of Bug 153755 . First we would have to make it API, then we can think of moving it somewhere else (ltk). ICleanUp has grown and is by now pretty ugly. It would cost some considerable effort to make it API (i.e. split it into two interfaces/abstract classes: ICU clean up and AST clean up).
Clean up is very Java specific, we would have to generalize it, I'm sure if it makes much sense to move it to ltk.

Clean Up API is not on the plan for 3.3. If we're lucky and find some time in M6 we can have a look at it. If it becomes API it would go to jdt.core.manipulation. For the least we will make the global action handler API, so other language plugins can also use the clean up keyboard shortcut. The refactoring UI framework is already available in LTK. I'm not sure if there is much more to share: I believe the clean up framework is quite Java specific: Evaluate which compilation units to run on, sharing ASTs, preference page with Java preview. Benno correct me if I missed something. Projects with mixed content might be something, but would complicate things a lot.

setting as dup of 153755. When we add API/extension points for clean up, this will be in jdt.core.manipulation. Until then it doesn't matter if the code is in the UI plugin or not.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 153755 ***
